intro: Horkelia caeruleomontana, commonly known as blue mountain horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in mountainous regions, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its blooms appear in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Horkelia caeruleomontana is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of these environments.
